articles.headline: Gretchen Carlson of Fox News Files Harassment Suit Against Roger Ailes
articles.snippet: Gretchen Carlson said that after she refused sexual advances by Roger Ailes, the network chief, he curtailed her airtime and later declined to renew her contract. Fox said it is investigating Mr. Ailes, who denied the allegations.
articles.abstract: Gretchen Carlson said that after she refused sexual advances by Roger Ailes, the network chief, he curtailed her airtime and later declined to renew her contract. Fox said it is investigating Mr. Ailes, who denied the allegations.
articles.lead_paragraph: Roger Ailes, the chairman of Fox News, was accused on Wednesday of forcing out a prominent female anchor after she refused his sexual advances and complained to him about persistent harassment in the newsroom, a startling accusation against perhaps the most powerful man in television news.
articles.byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum and John Koblin

articles.headline: A Ukrainian Kleptocrat Wants His Money and U.S. Asylum
articles.snippet: Pavlo Lazarenko, felon and former prime minister of Ukraine, is battling the United States for $250 million held offshore and for political asylum.
articles.abstract: Pavlo Lazarenko, felon and former prime minister of Ukraine, is battling the United States for $250 million held offshore and for political asylum.
articles.lead_paragraph: On any given day, Pavlo Lazarenko looks like an ordinary stay-at-home dad, shuttling his three small children to school and waiting for his young wife to return home from work. Perhaps he’ll run an errand or two.

articles.headline: Fed Officials Saw Outlook as Cloudy at Meeting Before ‘Brexit’ Vote
articles.snippet: A unanimous vote in June to keep rates steady was a result of confusion, rather than consensus.
articles.abstract: A unanimous vote in June to keep rates steady was a result of confusion, rather than consensus.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve did not raise its benchmark interest rate in June because officials worried that economic growth might be flagging, according to an official account published on Wednesday.

articles.headline: U.S. Safety Agency Investigates Another Tesla Crash Involving Autopilot
articles.snippet: As safety officials opened an inquiry into a Pennsylvania accident, a witness to the fatal Florida Tesla crash described a car that did not slow down even after impact.
articles.abstract: As safety officials opened an inquiry into a Pennsylvania accident, a witness to the fatal Florida Tesla crash described a car that did not slow down even after impact.
articles.lead_paragraph: The nation’s top auto safety regulator said on Wednesday that it had begun an investigation of a second crash involving a Tesla Motors car equipped with Autopilot technology, a system designed to let vehicles drive themselves for brief periods.
articles.byline: By Neal E. Boudette, Bill Vlasic and Annalyn Kurtz

articles.headline: How Gretchen Carlson Took On the Chief of Fox News
articles.snippet: Gretchen Carlson, who has not shied away from discussing sexual harassment, is suing Roger Ailes over his alleged conduct toward her.
articles.abstract: Gretchen Carlson, who has not shied away from discussing sexual harassment, is suing Roger Ailes over his alleged conduct toward her.
articles.lead_paragraph: On June 21, Gretchen Carlson devoted the closing minutes of her afternoon Fox News show, “The Real Story with Gretchen Carlson,” to discussion of a milestone: She turned 50 that day.

articles.headline: Email Case May Complicate Clinton Aides’ Pursuit of Security Clearance
articles.snippet: Fallout from the F.B.I. inquiry is likely to affect several State Department advisers who facilitated the former secretary’s reliance on a private server.
articles.abstract: Fallout from the F.B.I. inquiry is likely to affect several State Department advisers who facilitated the former secretary’s reliance on a private server.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Questions raised by the F.B.I. about the State Department’s handling of Hillary Clinton’s emails have cast a cloud of doubt over the political futures of a number of her top advisers, including some expected to hold high-level jobs in her administration if she is elected president.
articles.byline: By Eric Lichtblau and Steven Lee Myers

articles.headline: Italy’s Plan for Banks Could Roil Europe
articles.snippet: The Italian government wants to spend $45 billion to prop up banks laden with bad loans. That could increase the strain caused by “Brexit.”
articles.abstract: The Italian government wants to spend $45 billion to prop up banks laden with bad loans. That could increase the strain caused by “Brexit.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Even as Europe grapples with repercussions of Britain’s vote to leave the European Union, a dispute over tens of billions of dollars is also threatening to roil the region’s $16 trillion economy.

articles.headline: After Philando Castile’s Killing, Obama Calls Police Shootings ‘an American Issue’
articles.snippet: The president, reacting to a grisly video that showed Mr. Castile being shot by the police in Minnesota, asked the nation to confront racial disparities in law enforcement.
articles.abstract: The president, reacting to a grisly video that showed Mr. Castile being shot by the police in Minnesota, asked the nation to confront racial disparities in law enforcement.
articles.lead_paragraph: ST. PAUL — President Obama, reacting with the same horror as many Americans to a grisly video of a bloody, dying man in Minnesota who was shot by the police, begged the nation to confront the racial disparities in law enforcement while acknowledging the dangers that officers face.
articles.byline: By Matt Furber and Richard Pérez-Peña

articles.headline: Peacemaking Goes Awry as Donald Trump Lashes Out at G.O.P. Senators
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump was in Washington for meetings with congressional members, including one with Ted Cruz, the Texas senator who came closest to toppling him this year.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump was in Washington for meetings with congressional members, including one with Ted Cruz, the Texas senator who came closest to toppling him this year.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A peacemaking summit meeting between Republican lawmakers and their renegade presidential nominee, Donald J. Trump, descended on Thursday into an extraordinary series of acrid exchanges, punctuated by Mr. Trump’s threatening one Republican senator and deriding another as a “loser.”
articles.byline: By Alan Rappeport, Jennifer Steinhauer and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Ralph Lauren’s Turnaround Plan Has Parallels of Ford Motor’s Road Map
articles.snippet: The fashion company, under a new chief, is starting from a stronger position than Ford had in 2006, when it started its renaissance.
articles.abstract: The fashion company, under a new chief, is starting from a stronger position than Ford had in 2006, when it started its renaissance.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the Ralph Lauren Corporation recently unveiled a turnaround plan, calling it “The Way Forward,” it unwittingly invoked another all-American icon fallen on hard times: Ford Motor, whose “Way Forward” plan in 2006 saved the automaker from bankruptcy.
